text.section:
The Attorney General or any Deputy Attorney General or assistant Attorney General whom the Attorney General designates may:
become a member of an organization of attorneys general of other states or their deputies or assistants and, as provided in the State budget, contribute to the expenses of the organization; and
use the services of the Council of State Governments and, as provided in the State budget, contribute to the cost of the services.

section.section: On January 1 of each year, the Attorney General shall submit an annual report to the Governor.

The annual report shall:
describe the business and proceedings of the Office during the preceding calendar year;
include an itemized statement of the receipts and disbursements of the Attorney General during the preceding fiscal year; and
include any recommendations that the Attorney General considers appropriate.

text.section:
The Attorney General annually shall have published, in bound volume:
the opinions that the Office issued during the preceding calendar year; and
the annual report for that preceding calendar year.

section.section: The papers of the Office shall be filed in its offices until disposed of in accordance with § 10-639 of this article.
The papers and books of the Office shall be indexed so that they are readily accessible.
